name: Firefox Menu for Windows 7
description: Slightly restyle the Firefox menu included in Classic Theme Restorer add-on for Windows 7 (may also fix the menu button size for some users).

user.name: The Cupcake Generator
user.about: Generating cupcakes and userstyles with love since 1673 ♥ Powered by busy critters and sleepy snails.

additional_info: IMPORTANT This userstyle require Classic Theme Restorer (https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/classicthemerestorer/) and at least Firefox 35. Not tested with Palemoon. In some specific unknown situations the Firefox menu of Classic Theme Restorer may not have the same height as the default Windows 7 caption buttons, being instead smaller like on Windows Vista (18px instead of 21px). This CSS userstyle shouldn't be useful for most users except for those which encountered this small issue (like me both on a blank profile and my daily use profile). Also it slightly modify the appearance of the button, more closer to some old design mockups of Firefox 4 — from around 2009-2010. UPDATES 2015/06/01 • Fixed border radius when using private browsing mode 2015/04/08 • Original release KNOWN ISSUES By default the menu button will always be orange with this userstyle whatever release used (stable, beta, Developer Edition or Nightly). For Palemoon users, if this userstyle doesn't have any effects maybe you should try this similar userstyle by Ziz4rD: https://userstyles.org/styles/44185/firefox-app-button-like-firefox-4-mockups
